lines.content: * Represents the main class of the Chronos Task Management System.

* Initialises program and processes user input.
* @throws IOException If there is an exception when processing input/output.
* @throws ChronosException If there are invalid commands provided.
public void runProgram() throws IOException, ChronosException {
int statusCode = Parser.processCommand(fullCommand, ui, storage, tasks);
* Represents the main function to run the Chronos Task Management System.
* @throws IOException If there is an exception when processing input/output.
* @throws ChronosException If there are invalid commands provided.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, ChronosException {
* Represents the custom exceptions thrown in Chronos Task Management System.
public abstract class ChronosException extends Exception {
* Constructs a ChronosException with the specified error message.
* @param message Error message shown as exception is thrown.
* Constructs a InvalidByeException with the specified error message.
return new InvalidByeException("Invalid command. To exit the program, please key in bye.");
* Constructs a InvalidListException with the specified error message.
return new InvalidListException("Invalid command. To print the list of tasks, please key in list.");
* Constructs a InvalidHelpException with the specified error message.
return new InvalidHelpException("Invalid command. To view the list of commands, please key in help.");
* Constructs a InvalidCommandException with the specified error message.
return new InvalidCommandException("Invalid command. Please try again.");
* Constructs a MissingTaskNumberException with the specified error message.
return new MissingTaskNumberException("Missing task number. Please specify the task number.");
* Constructs a MissingDescriptionException with the specified error message.
return new MissingDescriptionException("Missing description. Please specify the description of your task.");
* Constructs a InvalidDeadlineException with the specified error message.
+ "Please include a task description and due date following the example below:\n"
* Constructs a InvalidEventException with the specified error message.
+ "Please include a task description and due date following the example below:\n"
* Constructs a KeywordNotFoundException with the specified error message.
return new KeywordNotFoundException("Keyword not found in any tasks. Please specify a valid keyword.");
* Constructs a MissingKeywordException with the specified error message.
return new MissingKeywordException("Missing keyword. Please specify at least 1 keyword.");
* Represents the exception thrown when the bye command is invalid.
* Constructs a InvalidByeException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the command is invalid.
* Constructs a InvalidCommandException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the deadline task is invalid.
* Constructs a InvalidDeadlineException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the event details provided are invalid.
* Constructs a InvalidEventException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the help command is invalid.
* Constructs a InvalidHelpException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the list command is invalid.
* Constructs a InvalidListException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the keyword(s) is/are not found.
* Constructs a KeywordNotFoundException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the task description is missing.
* Constructs a MissingDescriptionException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the keyword(s) is/are not provided by the user.
* Constructs a MissingKeywordException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents the exception thrown when the task number is missing.
* Constructs a MissingTaskNumberException object with the given error message.
* @param message Error message of the exception.
* Represents a task with a specified deadline.
* Constructs a Deadline object with the given description and deadline.
* Returns a string representation of the due date of the Deadline object.
* @return String representation of the due date.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline object.
* Represents an event with a start and end date.
* Constructs an Event object with the given description, start and end date and time.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the start and end date of the Event object.
* @return String representation of the start and end date.
* Returns a string representation of the Event object.
return "[" + TASK_CODE + "]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Constructs a Task object with the given description.
* Returns the status icon in String type based on isDone.
* Returns the status icon in Integer type based on isDone.
* Returns the task code of the specified task.
* Returns the description of the specified task.
* Returns the due date / start date / end date of the specified task.

* Sets the task to be marked as completed.

* Constructs a Todo object with the given description.

* Returns a string representation of the Todo object.

* @return Integer to indicate whether program should terminate.
* @throws IOException If there is an exception when processing input/output.
* @throws ChronosException If there are invalid commands provided.
String command, Ui ui, Storage storage, TaskList tasks) throws IOException, ChronosException {
